DataElement.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure Etiology Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of  abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person caused by an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure Etiology Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process as the cause any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure Etiology Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:The cause of a disease.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Therapeutic Procedure Etiology Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative disease which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20% blasts in the bone marrow or blood, and myelodysplasia.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
